description: This file contains selector functions for a React-Redux application's state, specifically for managing habits, categories, and check-ins in a habit-tracking app. It provides functions to retrieve active and archived habits, categories, today's check-in statuses, calculate completion ratios, and compute streaks for habits.

methods.name: selectActiveHabits(state)
methods.description: Returns an array of active (non-archived) habits, filtered by activeCategoryId when set in the UI state.

methods.name: selectArchivedHabits(state)
methods.description: Returns an array of archived habits.

methods.name: selectCategories(state)
methods.description: Returns an array of category objects, sorted by their sortOrder property.

methods.name: selectTodayCheckinByHabitId(state)
methods.description: Creates a map from habitId to boolean indicating whether the habit was completed today.

methods.name: computeDailyCompletion({ habits, todayCompletedByHabitId })
methods.description: Calculates total habits, number completed today, and completion rate.

methods.name: computeStreaksForHabit({ habitId, checkinsByDate, todayKey = getTodayKey() })
methods.description: Calculates the current streak and longest streak of completion for a given habit based on check-in data.

methods.name: selectCheckinsByHabitId(state)
methods.description: Builds a nested map of habitId to date to check-in object for quick lookups.

ctags.name: computeStreaksForHabit
ctags.pattern: /^export function computeStreaksForHabit({ habitId, checkinsByDate, todayKey = getTodayKey() }) {$/
